identified-content.classifier: Top/News/Sports/Pro Football/National Football League/New York Jets

abstract.p: Status of New York Jets quarterback Vinny Testaverde, who is in ninth month of rehabilitation from an Achilles' tendon injury that normally takes 8 to 12 months to heal, discussed (S)

block.p: Vinny Testaverde is in the ninth month of rehabilitation from an Achilles' tendon injury that normally takes 8 to 12 months to heal. He said yesterday that he was ''not quite 100 percent,'' but thought he would be close by opening day.

''I'm in a normal regular workout mode,'' said Testaverde, who was at the ESPN Zone restaurant to promote the Cadillac N.F.L. Golf Classic. ''The tendon has healed and I don't feel any problems there. Now, it's just getting my left calf as strong as my right. That may take awhile.''

Vinny Testaverde is in the ninth month of rehabilitation from an Achilles' tendon injury that normally takes 8 to 12 months to heal. He said yesterday that he was ''not quite 100 percent,'' but thought he would be close by opening day.

''I'm in a normal regular workout mode,'' said Testaverde, who was at the ESPN Zone restaurant to promote the Cadillac N.F.L. Golf Classic. ''The tendon has healed and I don't feel any problems there. Now, it's just getting my left calf as strong as my right. That may take awhile.''

The worst thing that could happen, Testaverde said, is injuring his right foot. ''Once you injure one, you're at a higher percentage that you might injure the other, higher than anyone who didn't have a tear,'' Testaverde said.
